main event: Multiple UFO sightings in Dayton, Ohio on 3 May 1949, including a sighting of a round, flat, disc-shaped object by Mrs. C in her back yard.
interesting points: The object was described as round and flat with a dull color on one side and a bright flash on the other, reminiscent of the classic flying saucer description.
Witnesses reported the object climbing rapidly and then leveling out before disappearing in the horizon.
There was mention of a 'flipping motion' and the object's rapid speed, faster than an aircraft, with no trail, vapor, or noise.
Both Mrs. C and another witness described the object as golden or bronze in color, and Mrs. C's son compared it to the lid of a large tin can sailing in the air.
The sightings were reported to have occurred in the evening, with the object disappearing into the 'red twilight of the horizon.'
witnesses: Mrs. C, Mrs. Blandford, and Mr. [Redacted]
